website_summaries.verdict: Budget-conscious consumers praise the overall value and performance of this dip station. The best bang for your buck right now.
pros: Stands out for its durable steel construction
Optimal for a wide range of exercises including dips, rows, and knee raises
cons: A few taller users say they wish this stand provided a bit more space

customer_reviews.title: Looked at many dip bars and I am pleased with this one.
customer_reviews.text: I love it and use it quite often as an alternative way of working shoulders and pecs (when I get tired of pushups). Being able to comfortably do 10 full dips is the baseline fitness I strive for. I am not a body builder, just interested in maintenance given the reality that many people lose 7 lbs of muscle per decade if they do not use them, and muscle means mobility, and when you are older you mobility is your freedom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for home...
customer_reviews.text: I really like having this dip bar at home. It's helping me get back to my old strength levels, even at 58 years old, and so it was well worth the price. It's very sturdy and goes together and apart easily, but I just keep mine out. My only issue really can't be overcome by a portable solution--they're too short. I occasionally will get a hamstring cramp because my legs are bent to 90 degrees, with ankle weights. But, I'd definitely buy this again. And my girlfriend likes it for her YouTube barre class.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: One side of the tubes were manufactured at an angle erroneously. I wasn’t going to do dips at an angle that put too much stress on my shoulders Not worth getting injured. Obvious that the company has little or no quality control with the finished products. I bought this based on a recommendation. Won’t make that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: elle

customer_reviews.title: I've had this dip station for 9 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in 2010 and am still using it, it is extremely sturdy and an excellent way to work the chest and triceps. I've 6'1 and 205 pounds and have used it on both carpeted and hard surfaces without any problems. Started out doing 4 sets of 8 full length dips and am up to 5 sets of 25.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Overall Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it is a little wobbly on carpet, but it is nothing you can't overcome if you are really motivated to achieve some dips. When I first got this, it felt impossible to do even one dip. Now I have a personal best of ten, and what I love about it is that it is always right there, so you can do these everyday and make progress.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: The product(s) arrived on time, as described by Amazon & manufacturer, it was shipped without issue, arrived within prescribed estimates, the packaging was undamaged, and the product itself was unmolested and made with quality materials. Description, photograph, website presentation, and what arrived are the same-size, shape, color, and it matched my expectations. My only complaint, it doesn't fold up or dismantle as easily as the description explains. Overall though, great little piece of equipment, overpriced for the value and if I had the time I would have built it myself. An addition would be offering a straight bar as an accessory so the person can use it in a traditional pull up exercise.
customer_reviews.author: 007Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get some dips in your life!
customer_reviews.text: Straightforward assembly and sturdy. I like how the top is angled so you can target more chest or tricep etc. I've used it some with a stretch band to reduce my bodyweight, and it works well. My husband uses it the most; it's lightweight and easy to move from a stored place to where you want to workout. It has a small wobble in it side to side, but you don't notice when you are using it since your weight bears down. My husband is 190# and it seems really sturdy. It's also good for rows (pullups) from below.
customer_reviews.author: T Miller

customer_reviews.title: Super solid
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'3" and 250 lbs. I break things. This took less than 5 mins to setup and is completely stable and sturdy under my weight.
customer_reviews.author: Sid F.

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sturdy product. I've the feeling it will well outlast me as I use it. It is also surprisingly compact, as I am able to fit it inside the trunk of my small sedan. I'm 6'1'', with arms longer than is typical for my height; even so the Body Press Dip Bar is tall enough for me to get nice and deep with my dips. A simple, sturdy design, which is also aesthetically pleasing. I've probably done well over 500 dips on this bar, and could not be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sotep

customer_reviews.title: Portable Easy Setup High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I drive a semi truck for a living and it's a struggle to find quality equipment that I can take with me that is compact lightweight but yet a good durable product this is exactly that I get it out a few times a week do a couple hundred dips put it away under my bed and go on with my life 5 STARS
customer_reviews.author: Johanna

customer_reviews.title: Decent portable option
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for nearly 2 years and I'm pretty happy with these bars. They were easy to assemble and make for a great, portable dip station. I'm not entirely sure they were worth the $100 I spent, however. They are a bit flimsy if used on a concrete floor. I'd recommend placing a foam mat or pad under them for the best set-up.
customer_reviews.author: N D Wilson

customer_reviews.title: great simple workout equipment
customer_reviews.text: it was easy to assemble and use. I'm a 60 y.o. male whom needed to increase my upper body strength to protect myself against injury while playing outdoor activities. My core strength has improved by doing the outlined exercises and some others which I improvised. I'm 6'-1" and about 220 lbs. it feels sturdy while supporting my entire body weight. I can even take it with me on trips because of it's ease of assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship, 50/50 you'll get a dud
customer_reviews.text: One of the bottom tubes wasn't cut properly. Taper in tube wasn't placed in correct location so couldn't interlock it with the other piece. Unlike another reviewer, I have no machine tools and cannot fix this. Sad to see this is not an uncommon issue. Returned rather than calling the company.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: This is very unfortunate. The right side is higher, it wobbles a lot and it's pretty much useless unless I want to have shoulder pain from how uneven it is.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: The unit to my surprise is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my needs. I don't have very tall ceilings exceeding 8 ft, so a taller vertical unit was not going to work well, but this has done the job. The unit to my surprise is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: The_Amazon_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Im 6'2" and it works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find this product, i have been working out at home for the last couple years and have been missing doing dips at the gym. This is very well constructed and seems very sturdy. I'm 6'2" and I have no problems doing dips on this. My knees dont hit or anything, obviously I have to bend my knees back but that is to be expected. Awesome awesome awesome.
customer_reviews.author: davidk

customer_reviews.title: Uneven bars ruin this equipment
customer_reviews.text: As many people have pointed out, the bars are uneven by design and I don’t like it. Go with the cheaper amazonbasics dip station. The amazonbasics one cannot be folded for storage, but the bars are parallel and it feels much nicer to use as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Getting stronger every morning 💪
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the dip/pull-up machine I used to have, this unit is compact and still provides an effective work out. It's a little shaky, but I am very happy with it overall. #let'sgetbuff
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: it is a perfect 5 star piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the mobility and versatility it offers, it is a perfect 5 star piece of equipment. I've done hundreds or even thousands of dips and rows on this machine and its still like new. There is a slight wobble, very slight with this because of how it is put together with the locking pins, BUT I do not feel that it is a bad thing at all. Once you start your set it is 100% stable and doesn't move at all.
customer_reviews.author: Van Skarsgard

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy dip station that's easy to store...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a dip station that would be sturdy enough to handle my weight, (185lbs) but easy enough to break down and store in a closet. This was the perfect purchase. I couldn't be happier. If you are looking for the same thing you can feel safe pushing the buy button on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre B.

customer_reviews.title: Good construction, won’t shake or wobble.
customer_reviews.text: Use this a few times a week, very sturdy, does not shake or wobble and I’m 6’ 230lbs. Grips are nice and soft. Easy to assemble and disassemble in 60 seconds or less. Fits under a bed or couch no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad Malik

customer_reviews.title: Expected more
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, but after reading the reviews I expected it to be more stable. The assembly is easy enough, and I'm not expecting perfection, but it doesn't feel stable when you're locking out at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S. Dunlop

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get a angled bar dip
customer_reviews.text: One side was angled much more then other side ,friend had one it was not, I’m into fitness I know what I’m talking about I’m also a fabricator and decent mechanical skills , I am 60 years old and know a good bar dip if your and old school person don’t buy a angle bar unit it is weird get a real parallel one trust me , I can still bench press 250 10 Times and used bar dips seems 15 so one great thing is no problem sending back and my money back
customer_reviews.author: warren gilbert

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I needed. This equipent doesn't take much space, and is portable.
customer_reviews.text: This workout equipment is awesome. I used to think, "How am I going to buy one of those dip exercise equipments, they take a lot of space." But this one, is exactly what I needed. It disconnects at the bottom and you just twist the bottom handles until they clip in place. I have mine behind my door in my room. Whenever I need to use it, I take it out and just connect the bottom of each of the two, together, and there you have it. I begin my workout. You can also do many different exercises with just this one piece of equipment. I DEFINITELY recommend it to each person that wants to build up their body muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I don't like is how one part of the bar is hard to insert and pull out like it's jammed or something (I have to wiggle the bar for it to move out). Other than that it's pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Ahteek

customer_reviews.title: Box to use in under 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to assemble. Colour coded dots determine where each end connects. I was using it in under 5 minutes of unboxing. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars, sturdy, comfortable, easy assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, exactly what I was looking for. I don't get why some people were complaining about the assembling.. it's extremely easy to assemble. It's color coded and all you have to do is match the colors and press down the button on one pole, slide the other pole with the hole over it and let the button pop back out through the hole so it can "lock" the bars together. Didn't even take me 10mins. Totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmine

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: The instructions on putting this together didn't make any sense. I ended up guessing on how to put it together, took about 10 minutes but it was pretty simple. I used it for the first time yesterday and it's very sturdy and doesn't wobble around which I initially thought would happen. I was able to do lay down pull ups with it and it didn't move or fall over in the process. I really enjoy it since I can't do much of a real pull up in my house.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Good for it's intended function
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. Materials are solid, the unit is portable and well made. Two improvements I would make: 1) Should be 3 or 4 inches taller. It works fine as is but I think a few inches would make it more versatile. 2) It wobbles a bit, but that is the nature of the design and does not take away from it's useful function. I would recommend or buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product Sent
customer_reviews.text: Matched all colored dots to assemble, the final product is twisted. Measured the distance between front 17 inches and back is 20 inches. Also base is not stable, try to adjust the bottom rubbers, they are loose and moving. Try to contact the customer service and they bluntly said deal with Amazon, since you bought from there..
customer_reviews.author: AKAlla

customer_reviews.title: Great for arms and abs
customer_reviews.text: The best exercise equipment is the equipment you use. Well, I use this a lot. It's a nice size, and I keep it in my living room. When I go by it, I typically do some dips or leg raises on it. I can feel my abs and arms tightening from using it. I'm so glad I got it. And it was easy to put together--I did it myself. Look for the colored dots, and match the parts by those colored dots.
customer_reviews.author: laughing water

customer_reviews.title: My favorite workout tool
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my favorite exercise tool. I can do dips and also inverted rows easily. Grip bars angle slightly outward. Two width adjustments good enough for short 5'-5'7" and tall 6' (I'm guessing). Weight doesn't seem to be an issue, the bar is about 1.5" thick. Unit shakes without weight, but when weight is added it is very stable for dips and rows. The bar connection ends are color coded, so installation is very simple.
customer_reviews.author: reviewermasterer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: As reviewers stated, it is a little wobbly, but it states that in the instructions. It stabilizes as weight is put on the bars, and you can turn a piece in the base to help level it. I love these... for the price, they are exactly what I wanted. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Compact and easy to store, I use this everyday. Perfect size for an apartment and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: its cool
customer_reviews.text: i little and i mean a little bit wobbly but i love it and everyone that comes over wants to jump on it and try
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Tube is shorter on one side than the other
customer_reviews.text: The negative reviews are right. I got this and the product was defective so I returned it immediately. I cannot find a decent dip station anywhere online!
customer_reviews.author: Elmer

customer_reviews.title: Comes apart easy to hide from my wife
customer_reviews.text: The ultimate body press is the ultimate body press, it says so right down the side. Comes apart easy to hide from my wife, if she gets stronger than me she wins. Also good for rows or clothing storage. Better stability than equalizers and more portable. Do not microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Satchmo

customer_reviews.title: Complete upper body gym
customer_reviews.text: An amazingly simple but useful tool. Virtually a complete gym for your upper body. Combine this puppy with resistance bands and you can do weighted dips without having to buy a stupid weight vest! Light but sturdy, and small foot print. Unfortunately I will have to give it away when I move cross country next year-ish but will purchase another one in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Philosopher

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive home gym.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it's a space saver. It is a bit wobbly but I did expect that. It's not so wobbly that it doesn't serve its purpose. It is still very sturdy. I do think it is a bit overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Otty

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, works great. Not easy to take apart / reassemble though
customer_reviews.text: Works well, i'm using it 3x a week for dips and reverse pull-ups. Very sturdy. Does the job. Also our 2 year old daughter loves to swing on it, and it's quite stable. One nit: it's actually rather difficult to take apart and reassemble. Those bottom tubes (the black ones) are super rigid, for obvious reasons. There's almost no give. Because of that, it can take some time to get both of them aligned, pushed all the way in, and locked. If you're expecting to take this apart and store it after each use (like I was), or travel with it, think again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan T. Flannery

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy product. Comes with a handy guide of exercises to perform. Minus one star because installation, while simply, is extremely difficult. I ended up shredding all of the rubber ends of the pipes just trying to fit everything together! I have no idea how to pipes less difficult to fit together (unless you're going to lubricate the ends).
customer_reviews.author: Scott Walters

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: We love this dip bar. Our family has been using it for about 6 months now. It holds up to plenty of use and abuse. One of the boys likes to stand on top of it and though I wouldn't recommend this, the bar can withstand it. Very convenient way to get a bit of extra exercise throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: MattFrederick

customer_reviews.title: The parts that came with it did not match.  It was missing a lock, the set up was not safe.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husbands birthday. He loved it when he saw it, but when he tried to assemble it, it did not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Solid and easy to put together. No concerns that it would tip or bend when using it. I'm 5'10" and fits well and my knees never touch the ground. The metal tubes are larger in diameter than I thought the photos and I like it that way. I thought I might break it down when not using it but it is too much of a hassle to take apart. I have extra space but please think twice about this one if you hope to store it under your bed.
customer_reviews.author: KaaTheSnake

customer_reviews.title: Space efficient body weight exerciser
customer_reviews.text: I use it for dips and for reverse push ups. Other exercises can be performed, and attachments can be added. I can't comment on those, but for dips and reverse push ups, it does the trick quite adequately. Yeah, it looks like a somewhat flimsy walker, but it's surprisingly sturdy. At 160 pounds, the last thing I worry about when using this stand is it coming apart. if you're pressed for space, this is a good consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Al G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and holds up well
customer_reviews.text: assembly is easy as parts are color coded. Use pretty much every day and it holds up well. Would buy again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Best investment ever
customer_reviews.text: This has been my go to apparatus during this lockdown. I’m getting the workout I need and keeping in shape with this bad boy. I’m surprised how sturdy it was and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Jorel Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sturdy and very easy to put together. The handles have a nice foam grip and haven't torn yet in 6 months Ive had it. I use mine on a foam mat and its very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have to get stronger but I’m happy with addition to my gym.
customer_reviews.author: Leo de Leon

customer_reviews.title: Easy stow away Dip bar station
customer_reviews.text: I don't have enough space to put a full fledged dip bar station, this one is small and easy to unfold to move and store away and the price is reasonable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: must have
customer_reviews.text: this is a great dip station for the home. it is everything that a dip station should be, sturdy, stable and affordable. I am 5'8" and weighs 140 lbs. so I would consider myself as having narrower shoulders, and I like the width of this. so, I think the dip station works best for small to mid body frame.
customer_reviews.author: Wai tam

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and store, works well
customer_reviews.text: Great for dips at home, easy to setup, just wish the bars were a bit narrower. Having a wider grip seems to exhaust me faster. It’s also pretty easy to break down and slide under the bed
customer_reviews.author: James C Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Better than I first thought.
customer_reviews.text: The dip stand took less than five minutes to assemble; it couldn't be easier. At first, I was put off by the looseness of the fittings, but I now understand that the stand was designed that way, in order to make it easier to break-down for storage and to reassemble when needed. When in use, the stand feels as sturdy as one would want. My one gripe is that the finish is a big poor. There's one spot where the paint hadn't been applied, and another where a good two-inch had been painted over. This is why I subtracted a point. Otherwise, I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B. T. Conway

customer_reviews.title: I hate going to a gym... this has it all.
customer_reviews.text: There are so many different exercises and then small variations on those exercises that you can do with this. It is solid design. I am 6'2", 180lbs and there is no flex or feeling of caution. I use this primarily for tricep dips, abdominal leg extensions, trapezoid dips, and pull ups (lying on the ground). This is a great all around strength trainer that you can use while watching tv. Who needs a gym membership or expensive home gym when you have this!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Marchant

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: The loose fittings make this very wobbly when moving it around and setting it up, however, it seems relatively sturdy when weight is put on it. I am disappointed that it's as shaky as it is, for nearly $100, but, I will test it and edit my review as I see fit. Wish me luck!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Knight

customer_reviews.title: holding up pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Im 6ft 1in 170 and it works great for me, haven't had any problems with height of the product. I have noticed that it is starting to get a little looser and have some wobble to it, but still very functional
customer_reviews.author: vincent

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great dip bar, efficient and useful for at home workouts. Can be taken apart but we leave it out because it’s a bit troublesome to disassemble.
customer_reviews.author: Nia Ita

customer_reviews.title: All parts not present.
customer_reviews.text: It came very quicker than I expected which was great however not all parts was present. I don’t have the full item. This is a major oversight and I have to have all parts to use the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jon-Mark Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great Dip Bar, bit of wobble
customer_reviews.text: This item was very easy to assemble and is easy to disassemble when taking it with you on a trip. My only real negative (why it doesn't get 5 stars) is that this dip bar can be a bit wobbly. It's not perfectly stable, which is irritating. I can do dips and leg lifts just fine, but that little bit of wobble just annoys me.
customer_reviews.author: theHeathen

customer_reviews.title: Great for Big & Tall
customer_reviews.text: The product is just as marketed. It does shake a little but it's completely stable when you use it. I'm 6' 3" and 280lbs and it still feels completely sturdy. It took me 10 minutes to unbox and put together. Bonus points for the fact that you can fold it and store it behind a door or something.
customer_reviews.author: JudeP

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. The only thing I noticed is that you have to rotate the bars in a certain direction to locked them in for stoarge and thats not obvious at first. This will make you strong.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES DOWDA

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed paid more for this product based on reviews
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine and one of the bar pieces was missing the metal click while another didn't fit properly .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really great for a small home gym/basement work out
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. This dip bar station is great for someone who works out at home but doesn't have the space for a full size dip bar station (the tall big ones). Only have used it once, but know this is going to work perfectly for my needs. A+
customer_reviews.author: a4wendzi

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Came in sooner than I expected! Was very easy to set up and take apart. It will easily fit behind a couch or desk for easy storage. It is very sturdy and I use it almost every day. The hand grips are nice and it overall met my expectations. I have a friend who wants to order one now too.
customer_reviews.author: Travoo

customer_reviews.title: Feels ok, but not sure about quality.
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is OK. But it feels wobbly and rickety after having been used only a few times. Wish quality would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: It has been a great addition to my home weight room
customer_reviews.text: Compact & portable, but is also well built. I weight 215 pounds & have done several thousand dips on it with no issues whatsoever. It has been a great addition to my home weight room.
customer_reviews.author: JG526

customer_reviews.title: amazing I can do inverted rows and dips love ittt
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my garage gym! amazing I can do inverted rows and dips love ittt!! very easy to assemble and cheap price
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: I am really glad that I got this for my home work-out equipment
customer_reviews.text: I am really glad that I got this for my home work-out equipment; it's sturdy, fun, and challenging. Do yourself a favor and pick this up. Also, it's incredibly easy to put together. Once I got the pieces out of their wrappings, I didn't even need to read the instructions and was able to put it together in a minute.
customer_reviews.author: E.L.H.

customer_reviews.title: Love it, doesn't take up much room
customer_reviews.text: Love it, doesn't take up much room. Works out great, can pack away if need to. I'm 185, takes my weight without wobble. Part of my daily routine now.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Woo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an indoor workout kind of person
customer_reviews.text: This product is actually really good. It has some weight and that showed some durability. I really enjoy the fact that you can take it and moderately change it to make it more compact for storage. The only negative thing about it (if I have to neat pick) is that it slightly wobbles, slightly. The fact that you can take it apart, the tiny extra spaces that make that possible make it slightly wobbly. Good height, good durability. It's a definite by for an indoor workout. Highly recommend it. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Magana Barillas

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'5", it's perfect
customer_reviews.text: for my height this is as good as a dip machine at the gym, highly recommended, it feels fragile but it's not, you will be good, I'm 5'5" 160 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro X. Egas-luna

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone
customer_reviews.text: My sister has a form of cerebral palsy and this has been a great product to help her gain upper body strength. The product is sturdy and can (and is) used for inverted rows, modified push ups, or dips. The machines at the gym of too constricting for her to use, but this product allows her the flexibility to achieve the necessary movements without hurting herself. Our house is too small to have a separate exercise room, so she is happy for the privacy of being able to fit it in the corner of her room.
customer_reviews.author: Exile District

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Dip Stand For Many Reasons.
customer_reviews.text: I love this Dip stand for many reasons. first of all, It's portable and foldable. I put it into storage every time I finish using it. Second, It's sturdy and heavy duty. Third, you can adjust the width of the stand depending on what part between the chest and triceps you want to focus on more. e.g. You can put it in a closer width if you want to focus on your triceps and wider width if you want to focus more on your chest.
customer_reviews.author: N.Yorker

customer_reviews.title: It's an excellent piece of equipment for the money
customer_reviews.text: There is noticeable wiggle-room in the structure even after assembled, but it's solid once body weight is placed on it. One of the best features is that it takes up very little space compared to other dip benches. It's an excellent piece of equipment for the money. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Tabber

customer_reviews.title: Shaky and unnerving until you use it.
customer_reviews.text: Putting it together is pretty easy when following the color coating. I believe the rubber sleeves are to cover the button locks for the tubing (at least thats what I used them for.) Yes it is pretty shaky but once you put your weight on it everything locks up and feels solid. The rubber grips are comfortable and the tubing size is big enough to keep from digging into your hands.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: This thing is cool. I'm 6'6" 220lb and it's sturdy enough for ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cool. I'm 6'6" 220lb and it's sturdy enough for me to do dips and rows on in my apartment home gym. Takes a wee bit extra effort to connect it after you've broken it down for storage but it's REALLY not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott John Burr

customer_reviews.title: Handles are angled very differently
customer_reviews.text: Product was solid and easy to put together. However, one of the handles was severely angled compared to the other one. Quality control control is definitely a problem here.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Thurman

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty sturdy, adjustable for width and collapsable
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty sturdy, adjustable for width and collapsable. Also, the handles are at a slight angle which helps some exercises. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Though I have only used it once since it was delivered yesterday, I am very pleased so far. My only gripe is, the connections slip over each other and lock into place with a spring button locking clip. One of the connections didn't fit right, stripped the paint off, and is still difficult to slide in and out for space saving and storage when not in use. Still with that in mind it's a good buy and I probably just got a 1 in 100 bad one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Miller

customer_reviews.title: Only sturdy with minimal movement. Otherwise, very wobbly.
customer_reviews.text: I can still use this for basic dips, but my intention was to get a dip bar that could be used for multiple varied exercises. Unfortunately, the lack of stability prevents many of the exercises I had hoped to perform.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah D Goerdt

customer_reviews.title: BEST PORTABLE DIP BAR
customer_reviews.text: I'm a prettying big dude. 300 plus lbs. this dip bar is well made and works great. I was looking for a larger dip/pull station for my home gym and came across this product. You can't do a traditional pull-up but it is great for dips and leg lifts. Bars are angled and you can adjust both height and width. Also, takes up very little space or can be broken down very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Its a bit flimsy. Wobbles quite a bit when on it. If you want something sturdy I recommend to go with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus S.

customer_reviews.title: Recommending it, but would change a few things...
customer_reviews.text: I weigh about 135 lbs, 5'7''. It wobbles a bit, but it doesn't make me feel like I'm going to fall. The grip handles could be padded more, not a biggie for me but my wife says it hurts her hands. I could wrap the handles with cloth/shirts but it would have been nice/more convenient if it already came padded with thicker/softer materials. Easy to install, just follow the color coded instruction. It's light and easy to move around the house.
customer_reviews.author: bunbao

customer_reviews.title: Great for dips
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't take up much space because of the design.Great for dips,leg lifts.leg crunches,push-ups,and i can go under it and do pull-ups.I'm over 50 and have been working out all my life.This Dip Stand helps keep me in shape without going to a gym.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He was pleased with the product
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my son who selected this item. He was pleased with the product. Do not know how well it has worked for him.
customer_reviews.author: Pat B.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I work on a Ship and the only thing missing from our gym is a dip stand. This fits perfectly in our small spaces and breakdowns easily. Wiggles a little bit but hasn't been a problem. Only wished it had a bar that you could attach to go across so I could add more exercise moves.
customer_reviews.author: Shalarra

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: Great for dips and hanging rows. Solid piece of equipment, not a must have but extremely convenient. Relatively easy to store as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Robbins

customer_reviews.title: The Ultimate Body Press Dip Stand - A great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Ultimate Body Press dip stand for a couple of weeks and it's a great product. It was very easy to assemble and it's solid in construction. The fit and finish is very good and the foam grips on the handles are also very good. Given the angle of the handles, you can target either chest or triceps, which is very nice. I was originally shopping for a more substantial dip stand but I'm very happy that I purchased this stand instead. We use it in our small home gym and the ability to pick it up and move it very easily is great. This was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ray D.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, super portable
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, well built and solid. Shifts a tiny bit when you use it but that's because of the breakdown segments. Shipped missing one of the little connection buttons so amazon just had me send it back and sent me a new one
customer_reviews.author: Dave Anders

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: feels a little wobbly but sturdy when full body weight is on it. easily collapsible, saves space and does the job. Handles could be padded more though.
customer_reviews.author: Issac Lee

customer_reviews.title: good enough, but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to assemble. A little difficult to get this thing to not wobble. It comes with these plastic leg attachments that helps to fix this, but I haven't been able to get it perfectly flat. The bar kind of bends when I used it, which is not that great but good enough
customer_reviews.author: le zhang

customer_reviews.title: Home gym for cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It suits my needs very well and it takes up little space.
customer_reviews.author: Inqbus

customer_reviews.title: Im 6'1" 257lbs and its stable
customer_reviews.text: Using it for my home workouts. Small, compact and most importantly- doesn't woble. Also its easy to assemble for retards such as myself :-)
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer007

customer_reviews.title: Rip in Handle Bars?
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the product is good. But mine came with a rip in the handle pads which I hope can be fixed by the provider.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great for the 4 hour body workout and doing the inverted rows! Sturdy and easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Stannard

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this just a few days ago and it arrived today! That's FAST!! I was really skeptical about the quality when I ordered, but when I pulled the pieces out of the box they were pretty stout! Yes, there is a little wobble but not too bad. Not enough to bother you when you're working out! Feels great being able to do bar dips again!!
customer_reviews.author: 3 Percenter

customer_reviews.title: Making it work
customer_reviews.text: After finely ordering the dip bar I have gotten alot of use out of it. This is a good thing, but, I guess because I have been using it alot it now has a tilt to it so it is a bit shaky when I'm working out on it. It isn't a huge deal but it does make it more challenging and not in a good way. Now when I use it I have to prop it on my mat and that makes it more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good piece of equipment for home
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it was bent but the handles have an angle. Good piece of equipment for home use
customer_reviews.author: Scooby Doo

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal...
customer_reviews.text: This of very good quality. I looked at lots is this is by for the best. Very glad I got it right the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure_Some

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with the dip stand. It does feel a bit wobbly when put together but becomes very solid when I put my body weight on it to do dips. It is small enough to not take up a lot of room in my office where I keep it. I had one I made from pvc. It did the job but was very bulky and unattractive.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wild

product_meta.title: Ultimate Body Press Dip Bar Fitness Station
product_meta.description:
THE DIP BAR FITNESS STATION
The patented Dip Bar Fitness Station by Ultimate Body Press is the only width adjustable Dip Station to fit you and your family. At 19 inches, Position I sets the handles much narrower than other dip stations and is a correct fit for most users, even younger athletes. Position II at 24 inches, accommodates builds from 190 - 350 lbs. Proper fit and form engages the correct muscles and reduces strain on the shoulders, elbows and wrists so you can focus on repetition to get the results you want in less time.

ULTIMATE RESULTS
• Dips get the look and performance you want - fast
• Angled grips support proper form for tricep dips and chest dips
• Bodyweight rows balance chest and shoulder development
• Knee raises and L-sits strengthen core and lower back
• Stable construction is always ready for your most strenuous workouts.

ULTIMATE VERSATILITY
• Two width positions provide a correct fit for everyone in your family • Assisted exercise variations let you complete full sets every time • Stores easily, folds and locks for closet and under-bed storage • Upgrade to full body workouts with Ultimate Body Press Bodyweight Resistance Trainers and Weighted Dip Belt and Agility Trainer. (accessories sold separately) • Compact design preserves floor space and is perfect for small spaces.

ULTIMATE VALUE
• Adjustable leveling feet are stable on any surface • Multiple exercises, one piece of gear • Fun and rewarding exercises deliver quick results • Exceptional engineering enhances the look of your space • Supported with our workout guides and 100+ online workouts, all free!

SHOP WITH CONFIDENCE
At Ultimate Body Press we are proud to serve your gym needs and want to exceed your expectations for customer service. Customer service has complete resources to assist you and is available by phone or email. Order your Dip Bar Fitness Station today.
feature_bullets: THE PATENTED DIP STATION: The patented adjustable Dip Station with 2 width positions that correctly fits you and every member of your family. Dip Station stands 3' tall to fit users up to 6. 5' in height and builds up to 350 lbs
EASY STORAGE: The only Dip Station that folds easily for transport or storage with fast color-coded spring-tab assembly that requires no tools. Quick-adjust leveling feet are firm on every surface

BETTER FORM: Exclusive angled grips ergonomically reduce strain and support proper form to rapidly sculpt arms, chest, shoulders and core. Premium pads and thick wall steel stand up to your most rigorous workouts

BETTER BALANCE: Bodyweight rows balance your chest results with back development. Take your workouts further with optional Bodyweight Resistance Trainers or the Weighted Dip Belt Agility Trainer for intense full body training (accessories sold separately)
DESIGNED IN THE USA: Ultimate Body Press is a North Carolina company committed to delivering better workouts every day. Includes Prime eligible shipping and USA customer service
SHOP WITH CONFIDENCE: The Dip Bar Fitness Station is backed by Ultimate Body Press against manufacturer's defects for 10 years
